content: In South Australia, the legislation that governs the rights and responsibilities of landlords and tenants is called the Residential Tenancies Act 1995 (SA). This act sets out the rules and regulations for the rental of residential properties in South Australia. It covers topics such as the rights and responsibilities of landlords and tenants, the process for ending a tenancy, and the procedures for resolving disputes. The act is administered by the South Australian Civil and Administrative Tribunal (SACAT).
